pageContext.claim: “We're approving more generic drugs than ever before at any time in the history of our country. That's bringing pricing down.”
pageContext.analysis: The Generic Drug User Fee Amendments (GDUFA) passed Congress in 2012 — before Trump was considering politics. The legislation was reauthorized in 2017, but according to a Wall Street Journal review many of the lower-priced drugs are not yet available to consumers.
